alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 1:02PM CST until February 11 at 6:42AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southwest Arkansas, Howard, Little River and Sevier. In southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. * WHEN...Until 230 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... De Queen, Dierks, Horatio, Foreman, Umpire, Idabel, Broken Bow, Lockesburg, Winthrop, Gillham, Ben Lomond, Arkinda, Athens, Center Point, Wright City, Valliant, Oak Grove, Millerton, Haworth and Garvin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
